ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Bus_element_link is a mean to describe the relationship between two elements of a bus that are linked by network nodes or structural definitions.
an attribute describes the other of the . It may be a or a
an attribute describes the first of the . It may be a or a
The precedent_element and the subsequent_element can not be equal.
The precedent_element and the subsequent_element shall be unique with a population of Bus_element_link.

ext_description.p: A Bus_structural_definition is the aggregate or composition of the mathematical or logical structure of the bus. If a bus were to be represented by a graph, the Bus_structural_definition would be a root node for the bus in that representation.
ext_description.note: A bus is a composition concept. Once defined, the bus definition can be used in various connectivity related aspects of the design. Several of the possible usages are conflicting and rules are provided to ensure unambiguous data. The structure of the reference model prohibits certain conflicting usages from occurring simultaneously.

Ordered definition of buses is supported in this part of ISO 10303 by interpreting the name of the bus element as indicating the position in the sequence, using normal ASCII ordering for regular expressions. Spaces are not allowed in names.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies that there shall be no more than one that specifies the Bus_structural_definition as its . The external_bus_access need not be supplied for a particular Bus_structural_definition.
a set of for the Bus_structural_definition. There shall be one or more for each Bus_structural_definition.

ext_description.p: specifies the string identifying the Bus_structural_definition.
ext_description.note: A project may establish project wide default names for buses. The identifier should then be globally unique within that project.

ext_description.p: Bus_element_links must be defined consistently for a composition.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The bus_name shall be unique within a population of Bus_structural_definitions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Functional_unit is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Functional_unit as its . There shall be one or more for a Functional_unit.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit.

specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit. There shall be one or more for the Functional_unit. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The functional_property shall be interpreted as overriding the properties supplied as for the in the role of definition when the are identical.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit.
specifies the name that identifies the Functional_unit, in the context of the .
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit.
The combination of the reference_designation and the composed_network shall be unique within a population of Functional_units.
the size of inherited from shall be one.
the composed_network shall be provided.
A Functional_unit_network_definition is a type of . A Functional_unit_network_definition may be either one or more of an or a or a .
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_network_definition.

ext_description.p: A Functional_unit_network_node_definition is a type of . A Functional_unit_network_node_definition is the definition of a node in the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Functional_unit_network_node_definition as its . There shall be no more than one for a Functional_unit_network_node_definition.
an attribute is TRUE only if the sum of usages of Functional_unit_network_node_definition in as or , and in as , and size of external_node_access is greater than one.
an attribute identifies the Functional_unit_network_node_definition in the context of the associated_functional_unit_definition.
specifies the that the Functional_unit_network_node_definition is helping to compose.
The combination of the functional_unit_network_node_name and the associated_functional_unit_definition shall be unique within a population of Functional_unit_network_node_definitions.
the valid_conservative_node shall be provided.

A member of Functional_unit_network_node_definition that is helping to compose an approved electrical or thermal network definition shall be referenced by at least one of the following:a member of ; a member of .

A member of Functional_unit_network_node_definition that is helping to compose an approved electrical or thermal network definition shall be referenced by at least two of the following:a member of ; a member of ; no more than one member of .

ext_description.p: Each member of Functional_unit_network_node_definition shall be referenced by no more than one member of for a specific physical partition.
ext_description.note: Some nodes are not connected to external terminals.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_bus_assignment is the relationship between the structural definition of a bus and the terminal definition of a network to which the bus is assigned.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_bus_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_bus_assignment.

ext_description.p: connected_bus and connected_terminal shall be unique within a population of the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_bus_assignment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_node_assignment is the assignment relationship between a node definition of the functional unit network definition and a terminal definition of that network definition. This assignment provides visibility into the node definition from higher levels in the functional decomposition.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_node_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_node_assignment.

ext_description.p: composed_node and connected_terminal shall be unique within a population of the Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_node_assignment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Functional_unit_terminal is an access mechanism for a .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Functional_unit_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Functional_unit_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Functional_unit_terminal.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Functional_unit_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Functional_unit_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Functional_unit_terminal.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_terminal.
specifies the whose functionality is accessed by the Functional_unit_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Functional_unit_terminal_bus_assignment is the relationship between the structural definition of a bus and a terminal that is assigned to the bus. The members of that are assigned to the same bus by this application object are defined to be connected to each other.
ext_description.note: There are cardinality constraints levied to ensure that the cardinality as resolved through all the references is identical.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_terminal_bus_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_terminal_bus_assignment.
A Functional_unit_terminal_node_assignment is the assignment relationship between a and a .
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_terminal_node_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_unit_terminal_node_assignment.

The consistent_bus_structural_definition function checks if the specified bus structure is correct.
It returns True if the size of the set of Bus_element_links specified by the input is smaller by one than the size of the set composed of precedent_elements and subsequent_elements of members of input, and if there does not exist an item that is refered by more than two members of input as a or a .
It returns False otherwise.
the specified set of Bus_element_links.
